definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Simple opinions on school-based curriculum development.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族中學校本課程開發的淺見。

sentences.english: Of course, this is only a humble opinion.
May I offer my two cents on this matter?
sentences.chinese: 對這件事，我能表達一些淺見嗎？

sentences.english: Let me give my humble option.
sentences.chinese: 我來說一下我的淺見吧。

sentences.english: Some humble opinions on how to strengthen the clean government in the fire inspection are talked about.
sentences.chinese: 現對消防監督工作中如何加強廉政建設談一些淺見。

sentences.english: I cannot have a complete understanding of the problem with my poor opinion and shallow learning.
sentences.chinese: 以我的淺見薄識是無法全面理解這個問題的。

sentences.english: Its effect is very good and it will be of the opinion written for communicate.
sentences.chinese: 因其效果甚佳，故將不才的淺見寫下，以供交流。

sentences.english: In the article, the author puts forward his personal views only on the method of separating load between cable and beam.
sentences.chinese: 本文僅就其中的索梁分載法提出些個人淺見。

sentences.english: This, IMHO, is smart and helps us out, too.
sentences.chinese: 以我的淺見來說，這很聰明，而且也幫助了我們。

sentences.english: So, ask everyone to see me to the shallow view of" the modern educates the technique".
sentences.chinese: 那麼，請大家看看我對“現代教育技術”的淺見。

sentences.english: Use what format to weave etc, offer oneself superficial view.
sentences.chinese: 採用什麼格式來編制等，提出自己的淺見。

sentences.english: Let me give my humble opinion.
sentences.chinese: 我來頒發一下我的淺見。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
